creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund
department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: Silk rug with a central panel containing nine Foo dogs in blue on a burnt orange ground. In the field loose clouds and Heavenly Jewels. Three borders the inner one with spaced red disks on a blue ground; the central one with a diapered floral ground and shaped panels containing Buddhist symbols; the outer one plain blue. Sides overcast; ends finished with red silk fringe. Cotton warp, sehna knot.
title: RUG
